alert.note: Alert for Barrow; Clarke; Jackson; Madison; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Oconee, southeastern Barrow, Clarke, southeastern Jackson, northwestern Oglethorpe and southwestern Madison Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Statham, or 8 miles south of Jefferson, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Athens, Statham, Arcade, Nicholson, Winterville, Bogart, Arnoldsville, Ila, Hull, Athens-Clarke County, Whitehall, Westgate Park, James Holland Youth Sports Cmpx, Bear Creek Reservoir, Diamond Hill, Beechwood Hills, Sandy Creek Recreation Area, Oconee Heights, Barretts Mill and Dunlap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
